instructions: These are the 3 sample drafts ready to persist to Firestore. Use POST /api/linkedin/content/drafts/store with user_id and these drafts.

drafts.title: Thought Leadership - AI as a co-teacher in K-12
drafts.content:
AI won't replace teachers — but it can amplify the one-to-one care our students need.

In classrooms with constrained staffing, small automation wins free teachers to do what humans do best: read, observe, and respond. Practical starts I recommend:

1. Use AI to surface early behavioral patterns (5–10 min weekly reports).
2. Automate administrative notes so teachers spend less time on logging.
3. Run quick A/B experiments on learning prompts and scale what works.

If you lead a school, what's one small admin task you'd offload today to reclaim teacher time?
drafts.topic: AI as a co-teacher in K–12
drafts.engagement_hook: What's one small admin task you'd offload today?

drafts.title: Thought Leadership - Ethical guardrails when using AI in specialized education
drafts.content:
When we bring AI into schools that serve neurodivergent students, ethics can't be an afterthought. Design guardrails that protect dignity and context:

• Consent + transparency: students, families, and therapists should know what's tracked.
• Human-in-the-loop: every recommendation needs a teacher/clinician check.
• Data minimization: collect only what improves outcomes.

These are practical, not philosophical. If your district had to adopt 1 rule today, which would you pick?
drafts.topic: Ethical guardrails when using AI in specialized education
drafts.engagement_hook: Which single rule would you adopt first?

drafts.title: Referral - Practical referral step for mental health pros
drafts.content:
Referral systems fail when they're friction-heavy. For partners: a one-page referral summary (student goal + current supports + contact) reduces back-and-forth and speeds placement.

Quick checklist for partners to build today:

1. One-paragraph student summary.
2. Three current accommodations.
3. Two prioritized goals for school placement.

If you work in referrals — do you have a one-pager already, or is it still a wish-list?
drafts.topic: Practical referral step for mental health pros
drafts.engagement_hook: Do you have a one-pager, or is it still a wish-list?
